item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is a curious thing, the death of a loved one. We all know that our time in this world is limited, and that eventually all of us will end up underneath some sheet, never to wake up. And yet it is always a surprise when it happens to someone we know. It is like walking up the stairs to your bedroom in the dark, and thinking there is one more stair than there is. Your foot falls down, through the air, and there is a sickly moment of dark surprise as you try and readjust the way you thought of things." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Everyone is in favor of free speech. Hardly a day passes without its being extolled, but some people's idea of it is that they are free to say what they like, but if anyone else says anything back, that is an outrage." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "From now on, ending a sentence with a preposition is something up with which I will not put." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive." -- John Green

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description:
"Many forms of Government have been tried, and will be tried in this world of sin and woe. No one pretends that democracy is perfect or all-wise. Indeed, it has been said that democracy is the worst form of Government except for all those other forms that have been tried from time to time."
(Speech in the House of Commons, 11 November 1947)" -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "She wants to know if I love her, that's all anyone wants from anyone else, not love itself but the knowledge that love is there, like new batteries in the flashlight in the emergency kit in the hall closet." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "A prisoner of war is a man who tries to kill you and fails, and then asks you not to kill him." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "She was wearing a pair of my pajamas with the sleeves rolled up. When she laughed I wanted her again. A minute later she asked me if I loved her. I told her it didn't mean anything but that I didn't think so. She looked sad. But as we were fixing lunch, and for no apparent reason, she laughed in such a way that I kissed her." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description:
"Criticism may not be agreeable, but it is necessary. It fulfils the same function as pain in the human body; it calls attention to the development of an unhealthy state of things. If it is heeded in time, danger may be averted; if it is suppressed, a fatal distemper may develop."
[<i>New Statesman</i> interview, 7 January 1939]" -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "After all manner of professors have done their best for us, the place we are to get knowledge is in books. The true university of these days is a collection of books." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Broadly speaking, the short words are the best, and the old words best of all." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "No intelligent idea can gain general acceptance unless some stupidity is mixed in with it" -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "I'm astounded whenever I finish something. Astounded and distressed. My perfectionist instinct should inhibit me from finishing: it should inhibit me from even beginning. But I get distracted and start doing something. What I achieve is not the product of an act of my will but of my will's surrender. I begin because I don't have the strength to think; I finish because I don't have the courage to quit. This book is my cowardice." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by George Meredith
item.description: "A witty woman is a treasure; a witty beauty is a power." -- George Meredith

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Nemo Nox
item.description: "Rocks in my path? I keep them all. With them I shall build my castle." -- Nemo Nox

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Give a girl an education and introduce her properly into the world, and ten to one but she has the means of settling well, without further expense to anybody. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Fernando Teixeira de Andrade
item.description: "Há um tempo em que é preciso abandonar as roupas usadas, que já tem a forma do nosso corpo, e esquecer os nossos caminhos, que nos levam sempre aos mesmos lugares. É o tempo da travessia: e, se não ousarmos fazê-la, teremos ficado, para sempre, à margem de nós mesmos." -- Fernando Teixeira de Andrade

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description:
"An offering for the sake of offering, perhaps. Anyhow, it was her gift. Nothing else had she of the slightest importance; could not think, write, even play the piano. She muddled Armenians and Turks; loved success; hated discomfort; must be liked; talked oceans of nonsense: and to this day, ask her what the Equator was, and she did not know.
All the same, that one day should follow another; Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday; that one should wake up in the morning; see the sky; walk in the park; meet Hugh Whitbread; then suddenly in came Peter; then these roses; it was enough. After that, how unbelievable death was!-that it must end; and no one in the whole world would know how she had loved it all; how, every instant . . ." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Ana Luísa add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description:
"Mar Português
Ó mar salgado, quanto do teu sal São lágrimas de Portugal! Por te cruzarmos, quantas mães choraram, Quantos filhos em vão rezaram!
Quantas noivas ficaram por casar Para que fosses nosso, ó mar! Valeu a pena? Tudo vale a pena Se a alma não é pequena.
Quem quere passar além do Bojador Tem que passar além da dor. Deus ao mar o perigo e o abismo deu, Mas nele é que espelhou o céu." -- Fernando Pessoa
